intro: Cullen balsamicum, commonly known as the red balsam, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It is a member of the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its vibrant red or orange flowers that bloom throughout the growing season. The plant typically grows as a trailing or ascending perennial, with opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for hanging baskets and containers in gardens. The plant thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot.
